results.title: Songs from Lift-off
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: This video contains a collection of songs from the children’s series Lift off, including “The Lift off ” (series theme song), “Into the unknown”, “Lost”, “Do you remember?”, “Which one?”, “Bonza jingle”. All the favourite Lift off characters appear in the collection.

results.title: The Infant mind
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discussion of the theories of Jean Piaget on cognitive development. Interviews with child psychologists who comment on the development of thinking, learning and problem solving.

results.title: The Preschooler's mind
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Time to grow”.
Studies the surge in children’s development between ages two and a half and six which Piaget describes as a progression from prelogical to operational logical thinking.

results.title: Teenage relationships
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, David P. Stone and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 23 of Series “Time to grow”.
Since the beginning of this century changes in patterns of labour and consumption in the developed world have led to the emergence of a distinctive period of human social development we call being a “teenager”. The teenage years, which correspond to adolescent physical development, are a time in which older children begin to move away from relationships centred on their families and to develop strong relationships with their peers. The teenager’s move towards autonomy can often result in friction between themselves and their family and friends as they seek to define their place in the world, and as they come to terms with their sexual and emotional maturing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, David P. Stone and Coastline Community College

results.title: Teenage challenges
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone, Lesley Purdy and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 24 of Series “Time to grow”.
Adolescence is a time of stressful change for teenagers often due to higher expectations, increased social pressures and more responsibilities. Approximately 20% will have trouble in coping and some will never recover from the traumatic effects of this period in their life. The majority however, through family and adult support and care will weather the storm. Divorce can be a major influencing factor in teenage anti-social behaviour. This program helps provide an understanding of this and other issues such as teenage pregnancy, anorexia/bulimia, dropping out of school and drug and alcohol abuse, through frank and open interviews with several young teenagers experiencing the challenges of adolescence.

results.title: Dark eyes
results.creator_credit: Nikita Mikhalkov, Carlo Cucchi, Silvia D'Amico Bendico, Exelsior Film-TV and Rai Uno Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Romano’s marriage leaves him dissatisfied, until a visit to a spa where he falls in love with a mysterious Russian lady. But when he follows her to Russia, the dream dissolves. Based on Chekhov’s classic ‘Lady with a little dog’, leading Soviet director Nikita Mikhalkov’s first film abroad is richly romantic - and ironic. Mastroianni plays the Chekhovian anti-hero to perfection, supported by a magnificent Italian and Russian cast. Mastroianni won the Best Actor award at Cannes in 1987 for his performance. Also stars Silvana Mangano. Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Child and the saw
results.creator_credit: Daniel Landin, Richard Heslop and IKON (GB)
results.brief_description: The child sleeps. It is the morning of her birthday. She chooses her favourite shoes and her special dress. She is nine years old today. A parcel arrives. The saw has come. They played and they played and played. And then the inevitable happened.

results.title: The Unvanquished = Aparajito
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bibhutibhushan Banerji, this is the second part of the trilogy begun by Pather Panchali. Apu grows up and becomes restless for experience. Set in Benares in the 1920’s, the focus is on the changing environment, contrasted with the stasis of village life in Pather Panchali. Apu’s restlessness and desire for more education brings him into conflict with his mother. This realistic portrayal of family life drew a good deal of criticism from the middle class audience of the time.

results.title: The Living machine
results.creator_credit: Gregory Andorfer, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Planet earth”.
Plate tectonics, one of the most important discoveries of the 20th Century is explored with world-renowned scientists on location. The program describes the first discoveries and what recent research has taught us about the creation and continuing shaping of the earth.
